glsa.title: flex: Potential insecure code generation
glsa.synopsis: Flex might generate code with a buffer overflow making applications using such scanners vulnerable to the execution of arbitrary code.

background.p: flex is a programming tool used to generate scanners (programs which recognize lexical patterns in text).

description.p: A heap-based buffer overflow in the yy_get_next_buffer function in Flex might allow context-dependent attackers to cause a denial of service or possibly execute arbitrary code via vectors involving num_to_read.

impact.p: Context-dependent attackers could cause a Denial of Service condition or possibly execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the process.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All flex users should upgrade to the latest version:
